snippet: Two of the leading candidates to become Egypt’s next president traded barbs about their political histories and arguments about the role of religion in public life.
abstract: Two of Egypt's leading presidential candidates, moderate Islamist Abdel Moneim Aboul Fotouh and veteran diplomat Amr Moussa, clash during the Arab world’s first televised presidential debate, trading barbs about their political histories and arguments about the role of religion in public life.

byline.contributor: Mayy El Sheikh, Kareem Fahim and Stephen Kalin contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: Two of the leading candidates to become Egypt’s next president traded barbs about their political histories and arguments about the role of religion in public life.

headline.main: Egyptian Candidates Clash in TV Debate, an Arab First
headline.print_headline: Egyptian Candidates Clash in TV Debate, an Arab First
